definition: to make one's bed on the floor
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to spread/to display/to set up/(old) holder for door-knocker
plank bed/place to sleep/shop/store/(old) relay station

sentences.english: When we finished the show, I would spread out the mat beside the stage to sleep, " says Li."
sentences.chinese: 演出结束后，我就会在舞台旁打地铺睡觉，”李宽说。

sentences.english: We spent half a month living on our friend's house.
sentences.chinese: 有将近半个月的时间我们在朋友家打地铺暂住。

sentences.english: Do you mind if I crash out on your floor tonight?
sentences.chinese: 你介意我今晚在你家打地铺吗？

definition: to sleep outdoors/to spend the night in the open
to look after a hospitalized loved one
to stay with sb/to ask for lodging
to lie down to sleep with one's clothes on
to put up a guest/to stay overnight
